New Records: Rohit Sharma scored 87 runs for India in the match.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 32 runs in the match.
Mohammed Shami took 4 wickets for 22 runs in the match.
India defended 229 runs to win the match by 100 runs.
Key Match Events: Wicket of Joe Root lbw Jasprit Bumrah for 0 runs (England 30-2)
Wicket of Jonny Bairstow b Mohammed Shami for 14 runs (England 39-3)
Wicket of Ben Stokes b Mohammed Shami for 0 runs (England 33-3)
Wicket of Jos Buttler b Kuldeep Yadav for 10 runs (England 52-5)
Wicket of Moeen Ali c KL Rahul b Mohammed Shami for 15 runs (England 81-6)
Wicket of Liam Livingstone lbw Kuldeep Yadav for 27 runs (England 98-8)
Wicket of Virat Kohli c Steve Waokes b David Willey for 0 runs (India 27-2)
Wicket of KL Rahul c Jonny Bairstow c David Willey for 39 runs (India 131-4)
Wicket of Rohit Sharma lbw Mark Wood for 33 runs (India 51-4)
Wicket of Surya Kohli b David Willey for 9 runs (India 26-1)
Pre-Game Insights: England needed 230 runs to win but only managed 129 all out.
India set a target of 230 runs for England to chase.
Eoin Morgan criticized England's performance as underperforming given their expectations.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed disappointment with England's performance.
Eoin Morgan highlighted issues with motivation and leadership in the team.
Rohit Sharma and the Indian team celebrated their 100% win record in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under dew conditions which affected both teams.
England's batting order struggled to handle the pressure created by India's bowling.
Others: The match was part of the Cricket World Cup 2023.
India's victory kept them at the top of the table with a 100% win record.
